sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: President Erdogan was among the first to vote, but with one of his rivals ahead in the polls as Turkey holds elections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The fierce battle for Bakhmut rages on with both Ukraine and Russia claiming advances in and around the city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: casting his vote in Turkey's elections on Sunday morning president Erdogan hoping to keep his 21 year grip on power in the mostly Muslim nation and prevent a shift to a more secular course

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Kemal KaluchdaroÄŸlu appears to be ahead in the polls both presidential candidates need more than 50% to avoid a runoff in two weeks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A high turnout is expected among the country's 64 million voters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The latest poll suggested a narrow lead for the opposition presidential candidate, Kemal Kilicdaroglu. Opposition is also worried about the tense atmosphere and they also wonder what's Erdogan's response going to be if they win.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Recently, Erdogan in a live interview answered that he, in that case, that he will peacefully step down, but he also said he did not expect such a thing to happen. Official results are expected later in the evening. Ukraine has regained one square kilometre in Bakhmut following the withdrawal of Russian

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: troops, according to British intelligence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian Deputy Defence Minister Hanna Maliar confirmed that Ukrainian troops are advancing dynamically in the suburbs of the city, more than 95 per cent controlled by Russian troops.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But Russia also claimed advances in and around the town of Bakhmut.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Russian Defense Ministry said in its daily report that Wagner Group assault units liberated a neighborhood of the northwest part of the city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, tensions began to rise elsewhere on the front line in the Donbas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In the Zaporizhia region, soldiers and civilians are bracing for the Ukrainian counteroffensive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The small town of Uri Kyiv, heavily shelled by Russian artillery and aviation, could be one of the corridors of attack leading to the recapture of Zaporizhia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Two thousand demonstrators took to the streets of Tel Aviv on Saturday despite a security ban on the weekly anti-government protest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The protesters criticised the intense fighting between Israel and Palestinian militant groups in Gaza, saying it's a distraction from the actions of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's far-right government. Thousands of Israelis have been demonstrating since January against the government's controversial judicial reform. A submarine carrying three tons

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: of cocaine was seized by Colombian authorities on Friday. It was their biggest drugs bust on a submarine since 1993.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The vessel, the fourth to be intercepted this year, was 30 meters long and was carrying more than 100 boxes of cocaine in the Pacific Ocean.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It was detected by Colombian naval vessels on radar.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The submarine had to be sunk to protect other shipping.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Three people arrested on board claimed drugs traffickers forced them to set sail with orders to take the drugs to Central America.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Our winner, Loreen, everybody!

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: You now enter the history books.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: After an incredible night of glam, glitter, and glorious tunes, Sweden's Loreen was crowned the winner of this year's Eurovision Song Contest, beating out 25 other countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: So thrilled for Loreen, the first female to win two times.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's incredible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's a pleasure to win two times.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Exactly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: So many significant moments.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Sweden's victory marks their seventh win in the competition, tying them with Ireland as the most successful countries in Eurovision history.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Despite not winning the top spot, Finland proved to be a fan favourite and secured second place with an impressive 526 points.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Israel's Noah Carell also had a strong showing, finishing in third place.
